JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy;Peer Lorenzen;Renate Jaeger
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the city of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG of Kharkiv ( “ the ORG ” ) against his former employer seeking various payments owed to him upon his retirement , including compensation for belated salary payments .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to another court for consideration but on DATE it was sent back to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found in part for the applicant . Both parties appealed against that judgment .
CARDINAL . In the period from DATE the ORG , having taken over the case , remitted it back to ORG on several occasions in view of the procedural flaws .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG amended the judgment of DATE , increasing the amount awarded to the applicant . On DATE the court adopted a separate ruling , drawing the attention of the President of ORG to the numerous shortcomings in the way the judge of the first instance court had examined the case . According to ORG , these shortcomings had caused delays in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant and the defendant lodged their cassation appeals before ORG . On DATE it upheld the decisions taken by the lower courts .
